Blitzcrank's hook is not anything special. Every skillshot is randomly visually incorrect. It's been this way for a very long time if not since the beginning. Maybe one day they will fix it.

It doesn't have anything to do with the hitboxes. I would argue Morgana and Thresh and such are more blatant problem champs to deal with because their abilities are slower and therefore it's even more irritating when their skills don't go the angle they are pretending to. Every champ's skillshots can visually hit a target but actually miss them, just as they can visually miss a target but still hit them. I'm not sure how often it happens in an average game but I know it happens more often at certain angle ranges.

The skillshots definitely go to where they are targeted. The biggest issue I see with players who would ever claim otherwise with their own projectiles are those that would intentionally or accidentally click on a moving target instead of on the ground.

Why do you think people hate Zoe so much? Visually inaccurate skillshots. I'm not joking. It's not her kit that's frustrating, it's the randomness/inconsistency in visual display inaccuracy.

TL;DR it's not a champion-specific problem. It happens to everyone. It's only frustrating for the opponents of the visually inaccurate abilities, but everyone sees the visual inaccuracy when it happens. It doesn't happen every time, but it happens every game for sure, so that Riot should be trying to fix it by now.

That’s how line skillshots work. It’s called “lollypopping”, and it’s to not make it as difficult to hit line skillshots in the game plain.

At the edge of the skillshot, it bulges out into a circle and finds a target to lock on to.

 for the most part hitboxes are fine.. the biggest two inconsistencies are exactly the two u listed

{{champion:202}}  W has a visual about 1/3 the size of the hitbox

while {{champion:99}}  ulti just seems to act weird at times

i mean its not that hard to to just play a custom game with said champion and press the ability to see the visual line indicator of the skillshot hotbox

as for things like {{champion:412}}  hook. the reason it "latches" to you n a different spot is becuase the animation of the skillhot and that colliding  is completely replaced with a new animation which is centered from the middle of the targets hitbox

it is _entirely_ possible that your champion model (which nearly ALWAYS extends past said champion, (and when moving most champions visually learn forward while this does not move thier hitbox) plus the fact that skillshot like champions _ussally_ have a wider hitbox than the visual.

it is VERY possible for the two hitboxes to collide edge to edge when it may not look like you got hit.. and  if this happens on a target where it is a hook and a new animation is drawn when u are hit... that animation is goign to br from the center of your model.

its really NOT something that is wrong... thats how games are coded.. its quite simple...

there is nothing wrong with it...

as a player u just need to learn that the visuals will NOT match the skillshots, and that you champion may visually lean one direction while moving but the center of thier hitbox is still in the middle..

The problem is most likely that the code has to be bitmap based, even at a HD scale. If even one pixel overlaps it hits.

Also, don't forget there's a bit of a lag time in deciding targeting due to the nature of the game and the players not necessarily being equidistant from each other. In othet words:
If a Morgana q is fired at 10:01:04.999 and is coded to have a travel time of 1 unit per sec, and your champ is 3 units away, even if you move during that time, if 3 secs later you were SUPPOSED to be hit according to the coding, you get hit. The game has to go off of coded response rather than video, while the players are the opposite. Unless you happen to be Faker and can pull off some Matrix-level BSery.
Hitboxes are fine. The only time you really see an issue is with vertical height, which has nothing to do with hitboxes.
